Installed and works great on MBP 13" mid2009

To install on a partition:

1) open disk utility>click partition>click "+" under partitions available.

2) create a name and select the size of your partition. I did 100gb

3) click create partition.

4) When finished, click the "Install Moutain Lion" file from the torrent.

5) the prog will ask where you'd like it to install. Select your current hard-drive or the partition you just created. 

6) the program will install. When it's finished it will restart. Hold the alt key down while the computer is rebooting. Select the hard drive you installed mountain lion to. It will install some more and require a reboot again. reboot and thats it!
@aneagle - Thanks for the info.

Disk Utility doesn't work for me so here is what I did. I went into Terminal and ran this command line

"sudo asr --restore --source  --target  --erase"

You can just drag and drop the mounted image and usb drive instead of typing the paths.

Okay, so apparently something I typed in the command line wasn't friendly with the comments.

"sudo asr --restore --source *mounted dmg* --target *usb drive* --erase"

@ HuskyGT
"i cannot use imessage or facetime says the server couldn't not register my user try later or something like that"

Try changing your DNS settings to googles public DNS (8.8.8.8 and 8.8.4.4).
To change, go System Preferences, Network, select your connection then click Advanced, go to DNS tab.
Hit the + sign and add 
8.8.8.8
and 
8.8.4.4

Can anyone please confirm if this is a developer preview?
Does Golden Master mean Developer Preview?

@GinoBimboinAZ: A gold master is the final version that is sent to the presses to make retail discs (or in this case it's the final build before Apple initially places it on the Mac App Store). Developers still get this version early but it's not considered a preview. I assume the uploader included "developer preview" in the tags so people can run across this newer one if they search for an older preview version.
